main event: On July 30, 1954, in Isa Angeles, California, two test pilots from Hughes Aircraft Corp observed a stationary light estimated to be at an altitude of 15,000-20,000 ft. The object appeared smaller than an aircraft and did not change shape or move during the 5-minute observation.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright and luminous stationary light, possibly composed of metallic or similar material.
The pilots attempted to climb to 11,000 ft and made 30-degree turns to obtain a better view, but the object did not change size, shape, or position during the observation.
A Navy aircraft flying from a southerly direction seemed to pass underneath the object without seeing it, indicating potential stealth characteristics.
The pilots deemed the sighting significant enough for a scramble and jet intercept attempt, but radio contact was unsuccessful.
The conclusion of the report was 'possibly Astronomical' with 'Insufficient Data for Evaluation'.
sighted object: stationary bright and luminous light at an estimated altitude of 15,000-20,000 ft
witnesses: Two test pilots from Hughes Aircraft Corp
